articles.headline: Shrinking ‘Quant’ Funds Struggle to Revive Boom
articles.snippet: The quantitative investment managers with high-flying computer models have lost favor since the big downturn.
articles.abstract: The quantitative investment managers with high-flying computer models have lost favor since the big downturn.
articles.lead_paragraph: They were revered as the brightest minds in finance, the “quants” who could outwit Wall Street with their Ph.D.’s and superfast computers.

articles.headline: At Treasury, Geithner Struggles to Escape a Past He Never Had
articles.snippet: The Treasury secretary from Goldman Sachs? Nope, that was the last guy.
articles.abstract: The Treasury secretary from Goldman Sachs? Nope, that was the last guy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Timothy F. Geithner has been misidentified as a former Wall Street insider from Goldman Sachs so many times since he became the Treasury secretary that he and his advisers had taken to joking about it. Then the joke backfired.

articles.headline: Banks Stuck With Bill for Bad Loans
articles.snippet: Big banks have already taken losses of nearly $10 billion on loans gone bad, though they were far from the only institutions at fault.
articles.abstract: Big banks have already taken losses of nearly $10 billion on loans gone bad, though they were far from the only institutions at fault.
articles.lead_paragraph: If nobody does their job right, and disaster ensues, who should pay for the sins of all?

articles.headline: G.M. Chief Sees I.P.O. As Exit Sign
articles.snippet: Edward E. Whitacre Jr. has looked forward to the day the carmaker would no longer be under government ownership, but thinks a public offering requires a long-term leader.
articles.abstract: Edward E. Whitacre Jr. has looked forward to the day the carmaker would no longer be under government ownership, but thinks a public offering requires a long-term leader.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Since he became chief executive of General Motors in December, Edward E. Whitacre Jr. has lived for the day that G.M. would become a public company again and shed the stigma of government ownership.

articles.headline: U.S. Assures Israel That Iran Threat Is Not Imminent
articles.snippet: The Obama administration has persuaded Israel that it would take roughly a year for Iran to complete a nuclear weapon, according to American officials.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration has persuaded Israel that it would take roughly a year for Iran to complete a nuclear weapon, according to American officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration, citing evidence of continued troubles inside Iran’s nuclear program, has persuaded Israel that it would take roughly a year  and perhaps longer  for Iran to complete what one senior official called a “dash” for a nuclear weapon, according to American officials.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: In Iraq War, Soldiers Say They Had a Job to Do
articles.snippet: Even with the end of combat operations, Iraq remains a job that inspires emotion only among those who do it.
articles.abstract: Even with the end of combat operations, Iraq remains a job that inspires emotion only among those who do it.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  Staff Sgt. Lucas C. Trammell, a tank gunner with the Third Infantry Division, fought his way into Baghdad in 2003. He was back in 2005, abandoning the tank for foot patrols in a very unsafe Ramadi, and again in 2007 as bodyguard for a battalion commander in Baghdad.

articles.headline: Israelis and Palestinians to Resume Talks, Officials Say
articles.snippet: The parties are expected to resume direct negotiations for the first time in 20 months, delivering the Obama administration a small victory in the Middle East peace process.
articles.abstract: The parties are expected to resume direct negotiations for the first time in 20 months, delivering the Obama administration a small victory in the Middle East peace process.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton is expected to announce Friday that Israel and the Palestinians will return to direct negotiations for the first time in 20 months, delivering the Obama administration a small victory in its protracted effort to revive the Middle East peace process, two officials briefed on the situation said Thursday evening.

articles.headline: BP Settlements Likely to Shield Top Defendants
articles.snippet: To receive compensation from BP’s fund, businesses and individuals will likely have to waive their right to sue the company.
articles.abstract: To receive compensation from BP’s fund, businesses and individuals will likely have to waive their right to sue the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  People and businesses seeking a lump-sum settlement from BP’s  $20 billion oil spill compensation fund will most likely have to waive their right to sue not only BP, but also all the other major defendants involved with the spill, according to internal documents from the lawyers handling the fund.
